title: Man accused of murdering 12-year-old girl to appear at Maitland court | VIDEO
content:
Sept. 24, 2015, 9:30 a.m. 

[embedded content] 

The man charged with the alleged murder of a 12-year-old girl in Aberglasslyn is due to appear in Maitland Local Court on Thursday. 


The 31-year-old man, the victim's  stepfather,  was charged with murder on Wednesday after he was arrested several kilometres from the family’s Aberglasslyn home two hours after the girl’s mother discovered her daughter dead in her bed. 

Police will allege that the girl had been assaulted sometime on Tuesday night before she either went to bed or was placed there. 

Exactly when the girl died, and what injuries caused her death, will not be known until forensic pathologists conduct a full autopsy as early as Thursday. 

No weapons have been found at the home. 

More to come.
